intro: Cliococca selaginoides, commonly known as the rockselaginella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features compact, succulent leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or white in color. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
